revised_title: Charles Tate Regan: A Pioneering Ichthyologist and Director of the British Museum (Natural History)
tldr: Charles Tate Regan was a renowned ichthyologist and Director of the British Museum (Natural History). He specialized in the study of fishes and made significant contributions to the field of ichthyology. Regan also played a crucial role in the development and expansion of the museum, focusing on research and the improvement of storage and exhibition facilities.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Ichthyology
